class.name: AudioStream
class.description: Base class for audio streams. Audio streams are used for sound effects and music playback, and support WAV (via [AudioStreamWAV]) and Ogg (via [AudioStreamOggVorbis]) file formats.

method.name: _get_beat_count
method.description: Overridable method. Should return the total number of beats of this audio stream. Used by the engine to determine the position of every beat. Ideally, the returned value should be based off the stream's sample rate ([member AudioStreamWAV.mix_rate], for example).

method.name: _get_bpm
method.description: Overridable method. Should return the tempo of this audio stream, in beats per minute (BPM). Used by the engine to determine the position of every beat. Ideally, the returned value should be based off the stream's sample rate ([member AudioStreamWAV.mix_rate], for example).

method.name: _get_length
method.description: Override this method to customize the returned value of [method get_length]. Should return the length of this audio stream, in seconds.

method.name: _get_stream_name
method.description: Override this method to customize the name assigned to this audio stream. Unused by the engine.

method.name: _instantiate_playback
method.description: Override this method to customize the returned value of [method instantiate_playback]. Should returned a new [AudioStreamPlayback] created when the stream is played (such as by an [AudioStreamPlayer])..

method.name: _is_monophonic
method.description: Override this method to customize the returned value of [method is_monophonic]. Should return [code]true[/code] if this audio stream only supports one channel.

method.name: get_length
method.description: Returns the length of the audio stream in seconds.

method.name: instantiate_playback
method.description: Returns a newly created [AudioStreamPlayback] intended to play this audio stream. Useful for when you want to extend [method _instantiate_playback] but call [method instantiate_playback] from an internally held AudioStream subresource. An example of this can be found in the source code for [code]AudioStreamRandomPitch::instantiate_playback[/code].

method.name: is_monophonic
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this audio stream only supports one channel ([i]monophony[/i]), or [code]false[/code] if the audio stream supports two or more channels ([i]polyphony[/i]).
